header.div: It is important to learn what is expected of you in the Speaking test and how you can prepare for it. Look at the information and advice below.

div.p: In the speaking test, you are assessed on the following skills:

ol.li: General fluency and coherence - that is, the logical sequence of sentences, the clear marking of stages in a discussion, and the use of connectors - study these;
The ability to talk about general topics in a natural way;
Using the right vocabulary to deal with your conversation - such as the range and appropriateness of your vocabulary, and your ability to use other words to cover gaps;

Using grammar adequately for communication - for example, the length and complexity of your spoken sentences, the range of clauses, and their effect on communication (rather than absence of errors). Learn strategies to cover your gaps;

h6.p: How can I prepare for the test?

ol.li:
Specific Preparation
The only one of the above skills which you can prepare specifically is 2. (Giving information about yourself.)

Learn General Language Skills
Learning expressions to deal with speculation, comparisons, giving opinions, will help enormously.

Learn Communication Skills
How to present yourself. Techniques to cover gaps in your knowledge. How to put your ideas in order. Suitable ways to end your contribution to the conversation.
